meanings.definition: Using or containing too many words
meanings.sent1: Her essay was very wordy, with unnecessary details throughout.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lectures tend to be wordy, making it hard to follow along.
meanings.sent3: The wordy email from my boss made me chuckle as I imagined him rambling in person.
meanings.sent4: The wordy contract was like a dense forest, difficult to navigate through.
meanings.sent5: The wordy novel painted a vivid picture of the setting, but it dragged on for too long.

meanings.sent1: I found the article to be quite wordy, filled with unnecessary explanations.
meanings.sent2: The speech was so wordy that many in the audience started to lose interest.
meanings.sent3: His wordy excuse for being late was so elaborate that it sounded like a made-up story.
meanings.sent4: The wordy report felt like a never-ending maze of information.
meanings.sent5: The wordy description of the painting made it hard to appreciate its beauty.
